# Issue 1903: elliptic curve period lattice Omega computation is always wrong the first time

archive/issues_001903.json:
```json
{
    "body": "Check this out. The first time I define an elliptic curve and compute\nthe period lattice, it always gives exactly the same precision, irregardless\nof the prec input.  Subsequent times give possibly correct precision.\n\n```\nsage: E = EllipticCurve('37a1')\nsage: Lambda = E.period_lattice()\nsage: Lambda.omega(200)\n5.986917292463919259664019958905016355595167582740265970681046757126500713973\nsage: Lambda.omega(100)\n5.\nsage: E = EllipticCurve('37a1')\nsage: Lambda = E.period_lattice()\nsage: Lambda.omega(500)\n5.986917292463919259664019958905016355595167582740265970681046757126500713973\ns}}}\n\nAlso, It would be good for Lambda to have a real_period() method that is the\nsame as omega. \n\nAssignee: @williamstein\n\nResolution: fixed\n\nIssue created by migration from https://trac.sagemath.org/ticket/1903\n\n",

```
Check this out. The first time I define an elliptic curve and compute
the period lattice, it always gives exactly the same precision, irregardless
of the prec input.  Subsequent times give possibly correct precision.

```
sage: E = EllipticCurve('37a1')
sage: Lambda = E.period_lattice()
sage: Lambda.omega(200)
5.986917292463919259664019958905016355595167582740265970681046757126500713973
sage: Lambda.omega(100)
5.
sage: E = EllipticCurve('37a1')
sage: Lambda = E.period_lattice()
sage: Lambda.omega(500)
5.986917292463919259664019958905016355595167582740265970681046757126500713973
s}}}

Also, It would be good for Lambda to have a real_period() method that is the
same as omega. 

Assignee: @williamstein

Resolution: fixed

Issue created by migration from https://trac.sagemath.org/ticket/1903

{
    "body": "<a id='comment:2'></a>This really can be closed now since I added the real_period function recently:\n\n```\n----------------------------------------------------------------------\n----------------------------------------------------------------------\n| SAGE Version 3.1.2.rc1, Release Date: 2008-09-09                   |\n| Type notebook() for the GUI, and license() for information.        |\nsage: E = EllipticCurve('37a1')\nsage: L = E.period_lattice()\nsage: L.real_period()\n2.99345864623195963\nsage: L.omega(100)\n5.9869172924639192596640199589050163556\nsage: L.omega(100)\n5.9869172924639192596640199589050163556\nsage: L.omega(200)\n5.986917292463919259664019958905016355595167582740265970681046757127\nsage: L.omega(200)\n5.986917292463919259664019958905016355595167582740265970681046757127\nsage: L.omega(500)\n5.98691729246391925966401995890501635559516758274026597068104675712650071397336580824078813479410294687168105420989457638828877447474405050875075334218652\nsage: L.omega(500)\n5.98691729246391925966401995890501635559516758274026597068104675712650071397336580824078813479410294687168105420989457638828877447474405050875075334218652\n```\n\nI am changing it to \"resolved as fixed\";  hope that's ok.",

<a id='comment:2'></a>This really can be closed now since I added the real_period function recently:

```
----------------------------------------------------------------------
----------------------------------------------------------------------
| SAGE Version 3.1.2.rc1, Release Date: 2008-09-09                   |
| Type notebook() for the GUI, and license() for information.        |
sage: E = EllipticCurve('37a1')
sage: L = E.period_lattice()
sage: L.real_period()
2.99345864623195963
sage: L.omega(100)
5.9869172924639192596640199589050163556
sage: L.omega(100)
5.9869172924639192596640199589050163556
sage: L.omega(200)
5.986917292463919259664019958905016355595167582740265970681046757127
sage: L.omega(200)
5.986917292463919259664019958905016355595167582740265970681046757127
sage: L.omega(500)
5.98691729246391925966401995890501635559516758274026597068104675712650071397336580824078813479410294687168105420989457638828877447474405050875075334218652
sage: L.omega(500)
5.98691729246391925966401995890501635559516758274026597068104675712650071397336580824078813479410294687168105420989457638828877447474405050875075334218652
```

I am changing it to "resolved as fixed";  hope that's ok.
